# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

Here is the Julia function `wrap_string` that wraps words into new lines based on a given maximum text width:

```julia
function wrap_string(str::String; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width && push!(lines, current_line)
        current_line = isempty(current_line) ? word : current_line * " " * word
    end

    push!(lines, current_line)
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
str = "This function will wrap words into lines"
wrapped_str = wrap_string(str)
println(wrapped_str)
```
